alert.note: Alert for Southern Denali Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 27 at 5:58AM AKST until January 29 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below zero. North winds gusting to 40 mph. Blowing snow with reduced visibility. * WHERE...Southern Denali Borough. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow, gusty north winds and cold wind chills are occuring this morning and will continue into Sunday. Snow is expected to develop Sunday night and continue into Monday. This may cause cause low visibility in blowing snow along with heavy drifting snow Sunday night into Monday. North winds and blowing snow are expected to decrease late Monday.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
